pullRequest.body:
Change the definition of `ProfiniteGrp.limit` from `ProfiniteGrp.limitCone` to `ProfiniteGrp.of (ProfiniteGrp.limitConePtAux)` to get better reducible transparency.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [34913e2c42](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21424/commits/34913e2c426f3ccead3301e092e56f2b84f9fac7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : CompactSpace (limitConePtAux F)`
`+ limit_ext`
`+ limit_mul_val`
`+ limit_one_val`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ee23c1f5-ac4f-4751-a1eb-5f4ed35511de) for commit 60de3d5de8fed38e012eed0ba21c14212afe7afc.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/17cd5d97-761b-4f2e-a4d8-ff4e8aaca86e/to/ee23c1f5-ac4f-4751-a1eb-5f4ed35511de) against commit 440c3d5524efacb02f3897055bb04260cdb9019d.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|+4.500⬝10⁹|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Category.ProfiniteGrp.Basic`|+3.171⬝10⁹|(+3.65%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13330622939)
Can you please fix the error?

> Can you please fix the error?

My previous proof rely on instance name which is bad, it is fixed now.

But for some unknown reason it tried to synth discrete topology on the Galois group which I doesn't know why.
@riccardobrasca May I ask you to have a look now? Thanks.

> > Can you please fix the error?
> 
> My previous proof rely on instance name which is bad, it is fixed now.
> 
> But for some unknown reason it tried to synth discrete topology on the Galois group which I doesn't know why.

The PR looks good to me, but can you please investigate this? If we have two topology on the Galois group this is something we need to fix.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1cbdaf86-076b-4b28-aeb2-7678d6365103) for commit 838c5046c0771c81747fe00ca5a70e1438a9d23e.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/43f1a3c2-d7a9-4b2a-85de-9c0e3778394d/to/1cbdaf86-076b-4b28-aeb2-7678d6365103) against commit 2836c275479466837c2593377bb54ae9fafc41d2.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-2.131⬝10⁹|(+0.00%)|
|`Mathlib.Topology.Algebra.Category.ProfiniteGrp.Basic`|+3.20⬝10⁹|(+3.46%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Profinite`|-4.401⬝10⁹|(-3.33%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13454067926)

> > > Can you please fix the error?
> > 
> > 
> > My previous proof rely on instance name which is bad, it is fixed now.
> > But for some unknown reason it tried to synth discrete topology on the Galois group which I doesn't know why.
> 
> The PR looks good to me, but can you please investigate this? If we have two topology on the Galois group this is something we need to fix.

It is only a time out, but simp definitely got into a wrong way, I'll try to figure it out.
When doing the simp on `IsOpen ...`, simp always tries to synth discrete topology first, which I doesn,t know how to fix, it not only happen here, I gave a test like this
```lean
set_option trace.Meta.synthInstance true in
set_option trace.profiler true in
example : IsClosed ({1} : Set ℚ) := by
  simp
  sorry
```
![图片](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9adca716-3609-4395-a860-09c8941110bb)

Sometimes the topological space just get to complicated and every thing go time out.
@riccardobrasca do you know how to fix?
I will not be at the computer for a couple of days, but feel free to ask on zulip. Otherwise LGTM.

pullRequest.title: chore(Topology/Algebra): fix definition of limit in ProfiniteGrp

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/Galois): Galois group is profinite

Can you please fix the error?

> Can you please fix the error?

My previous proof rely on instance name which is bad, it is fixed now.

But for some unknown reason it tried to synth discrete topology on the Galois group which I doesn't know why.
@riccardobrasca May I ask you to have a look now? Thanks.

> > Can you please fix the error?
> 
> My previous proof rely on instance name which is bad, it is fixed now.
> 
> But for some unknown reason it tried to synth discrete topology on the Galois group which I doesn't know why.

The PR looks good to me, but can you please investigate this? If we have two topology on the Galois group this is something we need to fix.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1cbdaf86-076b-4b28-aeb2-7678d6365103) for commit 838c5046c0771c81747fe00ca5a70e1438a9d23e.
There were [no significant changes](https://speed.lean-lang.org/mathlib4/compare/43f1a3c2-d7a9-4b2a-85de-9c0e3778394d/to/1cbdaf86-076b-4b28-aeb2-7678d6365103) against commit 2836c275479466837c2593377bb54ae9fafc41d2.

|-|-:|:-:|

|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Galois.Profinite`|-4.401⬝10⁹|(-3.33%)|
[CI run](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13454067926)

> > > Can you please fix the error?
> > 
> > 
> > My previous proof rely on instance name which is bad, it is fixed now.
> > But for some unknown reason it tried to synth discrete topology on the Galois group which I doesn't know why.
> 
> The PR looks good to me, but can you please investigate this? If we have two topology on the Galois group this is something we need to fix.

It is only a time out, but simp definitely got into a wrong way, I'll try to figure it out.
When doing the simp on `IsOpen ...`, simp always tries to synth discrete topology first, which I doesn,t know how to fix, it not only happen here, I gave a test like this
```lean

set_option trace.profiler true in
example : IsClosed ({1} : Set ℚ) := by
```
